channel.title: Having download problems

item.title: Having download problems
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

Ok, so I figure it must be a problem on their server, I tried getting a jar form http://www.moparisthebest.com/rs/tools/ and it downloaded perfectly.

what threw me off was the fact that it was happening with the official client too…

Read full topic

item.title: Having download problems
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

I have this code for downloading certain jars:

[code] public void downloadJars(String username, String ticket) throws Exception
{
String[] jars = { “windows_natives.jar”, “lwjgl.jar”, “lwjgl_util.jar”, “jinput.jar”, “minecraft.jar?user=” +
URLEncoder.encode(username, “UTF-8”) + “&ticket=” + URLEncoder.encode(ticket, “UTF-8”) };

	int length = 0;
	byte[] buf = new byte[1024];
	int all = 0;
	int read = 0;

	for (String s : jars)
	{
		URL url = new URL("http://s3.amazonaws.com/MinecraftDownload/" + s);
		File cur = new File(new File("bin/"), s.substring(0, s.indexOf(".jar") + 4));

		if (!cur.getParentFile().exists() && !cur.getParentFile().mkdirs())
		{
			throw new Exception("Could not create bin directory!");
		}

		FileOutputStream out = new FileOutputStream(cur);
		URLConnection con = url.openConnection();

		length = Integer.parseInt(con.getHeaderField("Content-Length"));

		System.out.println(length);

		all = 0;

		while ((read = con.getInputStream().read(buf)) != -1) // reading loop
		{
			out.write(buf, 0, read);

			all += read;

			if (all == length)
			{
				System.out.println("breaking");

				break;
			}
		}

		out.close();
	}
}[/code]

when the code executes, it runs the reading loop 4 or 5 times, and then hangs on the next cycle.

when i go through my web browser (http://s3.amazonaws.com/MinecraftDownload/windows_native.jar) for example, the file downloads fine

I thought there was something wrong with my download method, so I tried using the official minecraft client, and the same thing happens, which makes me think its a VM problem

any ideas?

Read full topic
